text: According to James, Christians should avoid partiality so that they would not be
explanation:
InJames 2:8-9 (RSV), James warns againstshowing partialitybecause it goes against the "royal law" of loving one's neighbour. He states:
"If you really fulfil the royal law, according to the scripture, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself,’ you do well. But if you show partiality, you commit sin, and are convicted by the law as transgressors."
This means that showingfavouritism or discriminationmakes a Christian guilty of breaking God's law. Therefore, Christians should treat all people fairly to remain obedient to God's commandments.

explanation:
According to Paul, the generosity of a giver will producethanksgiving to God. Paul emphasises that when believers are generous, it leads to others thanking God for the blessings they receive. This highlights how acts of generosity can inspire gratitude and worship to God.
Biblical Reference (2 Corinthians 9:11-12, RSV):
"You will be enriched in every way for great generosity, which through us will produce thanksgiving to God; for the rendering of this service not only supplies the needs of the saints but also overflows in many thanksgivings to God."
In this passage, Paul is explaining how thegenerosityof the givers leads tothanksgivingfrom those who benefit from their generosity.

text: How did the mariners know that Jonah was the cause of their problem?
explanation:
InJonah 1:7, the mariners, during the storm, cast lots to determine who was responsible for the calamity they were facing. The lot fell on Jonah, revealing that he was the cause of the storm.
"And they said to one another, ‘Come, let us cast lots, that we may know on whose account this calamity has struck us.’ So they cast lots, and the lot fell on Jonah."
